subject: Re: [junit] How to write a junitcode for the following code
msgSnippet: ... You should read the archives from about 2 years ago. Besides, the more people asking the same old questions, the more people will buy my book, so it s not
messageBody:
Rob Biedenharn wrote:
> At 5/12/2005 11:37 AM, Simon Chappell <simonpeterchappell@...> wrote:
> >On 5/12/05, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...> wrote:
> > > Would it be unethical to give a completely misleading answer, to
> punish
> > the student who was too lazy to read the JUnit documentation and figure
> > out his homework for himself?
> >
> >Yes.
>
> But sometimes it can be fun, too.
>
> And c'mon, how many times do you /want/ to give a sarcastic answer and
> manage to restrain yourself. I'm amazed at how calmly J.B. seems to
> respond to the same old questions.

You should read the archives from about 2 years ago.

Besides, the more people asking the same old questions, the more people
will buy my book, so it's not that bad.

(Actually, what keeps me going is that, sometimes, my answers to the
same old questions change. It means I'm learning.)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
